title: Retro Bicycle
content: In the world of the French constructeurs, André Reiss is held in the highest esteem. The Lyon based maker of Reyhand bicycles was an innovator, and was instrumental in setting a new course for other makers to follow.

title: Retro Motorbike
content: No matter how charming modern motorbikes are, nothing can beat the designs, engines, and functionality of vintage bikes. Have you ever dreamt of becoming a proud owner of one of the oldest vintage bikes in India?

title: Retro Camera
content: These days, you would be hard pressed to find someone who is unfamiliar with Kodak. While the brand certainly doesn’t command the power that it once had, much of the remaining worth of the company comes down to brand recognition.

title: Retro Car
content: As you can imagine, here at The Classic Motor Hub our team has handled a huge number of different cars and motorcycles over the years and a big part of our job is to advise clients on how best to sell their vehicle.

title: Retro Radio
content: This is a Philco model 46-200 AM radio, built starting in the mid-40’s around a very common five-tube design. This US company, founded in 1892 in Philadelphia, got into radio manufacturing in the late ’20’s.

title: Retro TV
content: You don’t have to look very far these days to see that the world of TV and film has gone retro. From movies like The Help, to television series including Mad Men, and the upcoming series Pan Am, it seems.

title: Retro  Typewriter
content: The International Typewriter was designed by Lucien Crandall and introduced in 1889. Manufactured by the Parish Manufacturing Company, it purportedly sported an interchangeable keyboard,admitting the board of any machine.

title: Retro  Telephone
content: Ahoy! If Graham Alexander Bell - the inventor of the world’s first telephone - had his way, that would be our standard greeting when answering the phone. Instead, Thomas Edison suggested “Hello”, a term that.

title: Retro  Projector
content: A few months ago, my wife and I found this beautiful old 8mm film projector at an antique flea market on Florida’s Gulf Coast. And it was very reasonably priced too. We thought it would look great displayed.
